newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Coceral sees 2.2 pct rise in EU 1997/98 grain area.
newsitem.headline: Coceral sees 2.2 pct rise in EU 1997/98 grain area.

text.p: European Union grain plantings are expected to rise 2.2 pct to 37 million hectares in 1997/98 (July/June), Coceral, the EU grain trade lobby forecast on Friday.
It put soft wheat sowings 2.0 percent higher at 14.03 million ha and barley 2.8 pct up at 11.66 million ha.
In its first forecast for the total EU 1997/98 grain area, Coceral saw the maize area 0.9 percent higher at 4.11 million ha and the durum wheat area 2.0 pct up at 3.02 million ha.
The increase in plantings follows a halving of the set-aside rate to five percent in 1997/98.
Rye was seen 1.2 pct higher at 1.34 million ha but oats was seen down 1.8 pct at 1.91 million ha.
The balance is made up of triticale and sorghum.
In February, Coceral forecast the EU winter cereals area rising 2.6 pct to 24.77 million ha.
